children.subject: Resolved: it is indeed due at 11:59 according to Patrick Hernan's email.
Applications are due by 11:59PM on May 1st, correct? I didn't see a time specified.

history.content:
***********Applications are NOW being accepted for Fall 2015 UGSIs************

 

In order to apply to be a UGSI, you must meet the following qualifications:

 

     1.      Be in good academic standing (i.e. cannot be on academic probation or have more than 2 incomplete grades)

  1.     Enrolled in 12 units of course work by the time the semester begins
  2.     Upper Division status when you begin teaching
  3.     Overall GPA of 3.0 or higher and maintain this GPA in the semester you are teaching
  4.     Previously taken the course, its equivalent or a more advanced course, with a grade of A- or better
  5.     Complete the 300-level semester-long pedagogical seminar on teaching in the first semester you are teaching
  6.     First-time UGSIs must attend the Fall 2015 Teaching Conference for New GSIs on Friday, August 21, 2015, from 8:30 a.m. – 3:30p.m.
  7.     First-time UGSIs must complete the GSI Professional Standards and Ethics Online Course by the first week of classes.
  8.     If you are an international student and Fall 2015 will be your first time being a UGSI, you must complete the Language Proficiency Screening Questionnaire  and attend the Fall 2015 Teaching in the U.S. Classroom on Thursday, August 20, from 8:30 a.m.-3:30 p.m.  

 

 Please note: The deadline for EE and CS courses is  May 1, 2015

 

Applications will continue to be accepted after the EECS deadline but are not guaranteed to be reviewed.

Online applications are located at: https://willow.coe.berkeley.edu/PHP/gsiapp/menu.php

 

For lower division CS courses, please contact Catherine Bouvier Dang at catherinedang@eecs.berkeley.edu 

For all other CS courses and EE courses, please contact Pat Hernan at hernan@eecs.berkeley.edu
history.subject: Apply to be a Fall 2015 UGSI! (Due May 1)
